00020 /**
00021  * @file   LineFile.h
00022  * @author Mybrid Spalding
00023  * @date   Mon May 23 11:27:16 2005
00024  *
00025  * @brief  DO NOT USE. Except in cases of test code. Platform safe file class to read lines.
00026  */
00027 
00028 #ifndef _LINE_FILE_H_
00029 #define _LINE_FILE_H_
00030 
00031 //
00032 #include <fstream>
00033 #include <string>
00034 //
00035 
00036 /**
00037  *  LineFile
00038  * @brief Platform safe class for reading lines.
00039  *
00040  * For Test Code ONLY.
00041  * Chances are you should be using file/TsvFile/TsvFile
00042  * and not this object. This file is intended for test code in util/
00043  * being used by file/TsvFile/TsvFile and other
00044  * code not using TsvFile.
00045  */
00046 
00047 class LineFile
00048 {
00049 
00050 public:
00051 
00052   /** Line endings are platform specific, this encodes different types
00053       we know of. */
00054   enum FileLineEnding {
00055     UNIX = 0,   // '\n'
00056     DOS = 1,    // '\r\n'
00057     MAC = 2,    // '\r'
00058     UNKNOWN = 3 // ???
00059   };
00060 
00061   /**
00062    * Constructor.
00063    */
00064   LineFile();
00065 
00066   /**
00067    * @brief Destructor closes stream.
00068    */
00069   virtual ~LineFile();
00070 
00071   /**
00072    * @brief Platform safe open for read, can be used multiple times
00073    * with different file names.
00074    * @return ifstream in question.
00075    *         
00076    */
00077   std::ifstream & open(const std::string & fileName, bool abortOnError = false);
00078   /**
00079    * @brief close the ifstream if needed. 
00080    * @return void
00081    */
00082   void            close();
00083 
00084   /**
00085    * @brief Platform safe reading of a line, stripping the eol.
00086    * File is automatically closed when eof is reached.
00087    * @param line - returned if possible, cleared otherwise.
00088    * @param trim - false by default, true strips trailing spaces.
00089    * @return true if line is returned.
00090    *         line will be cleared when false is returned. .
00091    */
00092   bool getline(std::string & line, bool trim = false);
00093 
00094   /**
00095    * @brief What type of file is this one?
00096    * @return Type of file that has been determined.
00097    */
00098   enum FileLineEnding getFileType() {
00099     return m_endType;
00100   }
00101 
00102   /**
00103    * @brief What is the name of the file we're reading from?
00104    * @return name of file being read.
00105    */
00106   std::string getFileName() {
00107     return m_fileName;
00108   }
00109 
00110   /**
00111    * @brief - get the input file stream.
00112    * @return ifstream reference.
00113    */
00114   std::ifstream & getStream() {
00115     return m_fileStream;
00116   }
00117 
00118   bool is_open() {
00119     return m_fileStream.is_open();
00120   }
00121   bool fail() {
00122     return m_fileStream.fail();
00123   }
00124   bool eof() {
00125     return m_fileStream.eof() ;
00126   }
00127 
00128 private:
00129 
00130   std::string m_fileName;
00131   std::ifstream m_fileStream;
00132   enum FileLineEnding m_endType;
00133 
00134 
00135 };
00136 
00137 #endif /* _LINE_FILE_ */
